tag_professor: Hilarious (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Inspirational (1)
comments: He teaches the material very effectively. He is definitely a democrat and will talk about the issues that he cares about. Provides good discussion on those topics though and does not discriminate against different opinions. Upperclassmen... attendance is not really mandatory. I would take him again.

tag_professor: Hilarious (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Inspirational (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  HILARIOUS
comments: He is a great professor. He teaches everything you need to know in his lectures. The book is not used at all. He tries to make his lectures entertaining and the material is decent. He does want his class to succeed. For his tests: study, do the study guide, and read the articles he give because there is probably an essay on it. Have fun!

tag_professor: Hilarious (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Inspirational (1)
stu_tags: HILARIOUS  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  GRADED BY FEW THINGS
comments: No extra credit offered so make sure you do awesome on the quizzes and especially the tests! We didn\'t use the textbook AT ALL so don\'t bother getting it. All material comes from lectures - make sure you attend class. He was pretty good for a general education science professor - I\'ve had some pretty bad ones.

tag_professor: Hilarious (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Inspirational (1)
comments: I took intro to life science in the may session. Aka 3 weeks of cake work and an easy A to show for it. Tests are straight off of labs and powerpoints and the final is just the first test combined with the second section. Friendly, if a little boring. Field trips are frequent and can be dull but can also be quite the adventure haha. Only complaints: goes slow through material and says "mmkay" all the time haha. A laid back course and an easy gen Ed out of the way.
